What‚Äôs this blog for?
I‚Äôve had several failed R blogs which tried to do too many
things:
www.visibledata.co.uk was
designed as the company website for my R consultancy work. It was
abandoned in favour of‚Ä¶
www.findingyourway.io was to
accompany a book project I abandoned. It has lots of wonderfully
customised (Bootstrap flavoured) CSS.
But these days I do my consultancy through the awesome R for The Rest of Us team.
That‚Äôs also where my fancy markety
blogposts.
This is going to be the home for #30DayChartChallenge, #TidyTuesday
and other things.
To prevent this from going the way of the abandoned projects, here
are my rules:
All custom CSS needs to be declared here.
All {distill} modifications need to be declared here.
Customisations
Showing recent posts on
the home page
The home page shows a list of all blogposts, which is achieved by
adding this to the index.Rmd file:

---
title: "Posts"
listing: posts
site: distill::distill_website
---

To place additional content about the posts I make use of
<d-byline></d-byline> which forces the content
below into a comfortable position.
Tutorials used
https://themockup.blog/posts/2020-08-01-building-a-blog-with-distill/
